definitions.definition: Covered or splashed with, or full of, mud ( “ wet soil ” ) .
examples: He slogged across the muddy field.
Take off your muddy boots before you come inside.

definitions.definition: Of water or some other liquid : containing mud or ( by extension ) other sediment in suspension ; cloudy , turbid .
examples: The previously limpid water was now muddy as a result of the struggle between the alligator and the wild boar.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to mud; also, having the characteristics of mud, especially in colour or taste .
Of an animal or plant : growing or living in mud.

subdefinitions.definition: Not clear . Of a colour: not bright : dirty , dull . Of an image : blurry or dim . Of light : cloudy, opaque . Of sound (especially during performance , recording , or playback ): indistinct , muffled . Of speech , thinking , or writing : ambiguous or vague ; or confused , incoherent , or mixed-up ; also, poorly expressed . ( chiefly literary , poetic ) Of the air : not fresh ; impure , polluted .
examples: The television picture is decent, but the sound is muddy .

subdefinitions.definition: Originally, morally or religiously wrong ; corrupt , sinful ; now, morally or legally dubious ; shady , sketchy .
Of a person or their facial expression : angry , sad , or sulky .

main_definition: Covered or splashed with, or full of, mud ( “ wet soil ” ) .
secondary_definitions: Of water or some other liquid : containing mud or ( by extension ) other sediment in suspension ; cloudy , turbid .
Of or relating to mud; also, having the characteristics of mud, especially in colour or taste .
( archaic ) Of an animal or plant : growing or living in mud.
